cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north then north-northeast, accelerating toward the southeast U.S. coast, expected to come ashore in eastern SC / southern NC and then race up the Mid-Atlantic coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina (near the Cape Fear–Surf City area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: South Santee River SC to Surf City NC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Ocracoke Inlet NC (Tropical Storm Warning); Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina and North Carolina coastline, extending northward along the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (34–50 kt) with gusts possibly reaching hurricane strength Monday night through early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent sounds, including Wilmington
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated amounts to 8 inches could produce flash flooding in and around Wilmington
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes Monday night; dangerous surf and rip currents
